translation: Here begins the description of the incarnations named Nar and Narayan:

gurmukhi: ਨਰੰ ਅੳੁਰ ਨਾਰਾੲਿਣੰ ਰੂਪ ਧਾਰੀ || ਭਯੋ ਸਾਮੁਹੇ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਅਸਤ੍ਰੰ ਸੰਭਾਰੀ ||
transliteration: Naran Aur Naaraainan Roop Dhdaree|| Bhayo Saamuhe Sastra Astran Sanbhdaree||
translation: Manifesting himself as Nar and Narayan, Vishnu, managing his weapons and arms, came in front of the demon-forces.

gurmukhi: ਭਟੰ ਅੈਂਠ ਫੈਂਟੇ ਭੁਜੰ ਠੋਕ ਭੂਪੰ || ਬਜੇ ਸੂਲ ਸੇਲੰ ਭੲੇ ਅਾਪ ਰੂਪੰ ||੧੫||
transliteration: Bhatan Ainth Phainte Bhujan Thok Bhoopan|| Bade Sool Selan Bhae Aap Roopan||15||
translation: The warriors tied their garments tightly and the kings beat their arms; it, that war, the tridents and the spears began to collide with each other.15.

gurmukhi: ਪਰਯੋ ਅਾਪ ਮੋ ਲੋਹਿ ਕ੍ਰੋਹੰ ਅਪਾਰੰ || ਧਰਯੋ ਅੈਸ ਕੈ ਬਿਸਨ ਤ੍ਰਿਤੀਅਾਵਤਾਰੰ ||
transliteration: Daryo Aap Mo Loh(i) Krohan Apaaran|| Ddaryo Ais Kai Bisan Triteeaavtaaran||
translation: In great anger. The blows of the steel-arms began to rain and at this juncture Vishnu manifested his third incarnation.

gurmukhi: ਨਰੰ ੲੇਕ ਨਾਰਾੲਿਣੰ ਦੁਅੈ ਸਰੂਪੰ || ਦਿਪੈ ਜੋਤਿ ਸੳੁਦਰਜੁ ਧਾਰੇ ਅਨੂਪੰ ||੧੬||
transliteration: Naran Ek Naaraainan Duai Daroopan|| Dipai Jot(i) Saudaraj(u) Dhdare Anoopan||16||
translation: Nar and Narayan both had similar forms and their effulgence assumed unparalleled Lustre.16.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਠੇ ਟੂਪ ਟੋਪੰ ਗੁਰੰਜ ਪ੍ਹਾਰੇ || ਜੁਟੇ ਜੰਗ ਕੋ ਜੰਗ ਜੋਧਾ ਜੁਝਾਰੇ ||
transliteration: Outhe Toop Topan Guranj Prahdare|| Joute Jan Ko Jan Jodhaa Jujhdare||
translation: Wearing their helmets the warriors are striking their blows with maces and the mighty heroes are engrossed in the war.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਡੀ ਧੂਰਿ ਪੂਰੰ ਛੁਹੀ ਅੈਨ ਗੈਨੰ || ਡਿਗੇ ਦੇਵਤਾ ਦੈਤ ਕੰਪਿਯੋ ਤ੍ਰਿਨੈਨੰ ||੧੭||
transliteration: Udidhoor(i) Pooran Chhuhiain Gadnan|| Dige Devtaa Dait Kanpiyo Trinainan||17||
translation: The dust hath both the gods and demons, having gone astray, were falling and even the three-eyed god Shiva trembled.17.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰੇ ਬੀਰ ੲੇਕੰ ਅਨੇਕੰ ਪ੍ਰਕਾਰੰ || ਸੁਭੇ ਜੰਗ ਮੋ ਜੰਗ ਜੋਧਾ ਜੁਝਾਰੰ ||
transliteration: Gire Beer Ekan Anekan Prakaaran|| Soubhe Jan Mo Jan Jodhaa Jujaaran||
translation: Many types of warriors fell in the field and the great fighters looked impressive in the war.

gurmukhi: ਪਰੀ ਤੱਛ ਮੁੱਛੰ ਸੁਭੇ ਅੰਗ ਭੰਗੰ || ਮਨੋ ਪਾਨ ਕੈ ਭੰਗ ਪੌਢੇ ਮਲੰਗੰ ||੧੮||
transliteration: Paritachchh Mouchchhan Soubhe An Bhanadg|| Mano Paan Kai Bhan Paudhe Malanadg||18||
translation: The brave fighters, being chopped into bits, began to fall and it appeared that the wrestlers are lying intoxicated after drinking hemp.18.
